unnormalised: Delhi traffic, a national pastime more thrilling than any IPL match, reached peak performance today. Sources confirm that the usual 20-minute drive from Connaught Place to India Gate clocked in at a cool 2 hours 30 mins. Motorists were seen engaging in intense staring contests with auto-rickshaw drivers and sharing chai (Rs. 10 a cup, inflated to Rs. 20 due to the 'scenic route').
normalised: Delhi traffic, a national pastime more thrilling than any I-P-L match, reached peak performance today. Sources confirm that the usual twenty minute drive from Connaught Place to India Gate clocked in at a cool two hours thirty minutes. Motorists were seen engaging in intense staring contests with auto-rickshaw drivers and sharing chai (rupees ten a cup, inflated to rupees twenty due to the 'scenic route').

unnormalised: The cause? A cow, lovingly nicknamed "Traffic Devi" by the locals, decided to take a nap smack-dab in the middle of the road. Attempts to 'prepone' her siesta were met with soulful moos and the collective guilt of a nation that respects its bovine citizens. One eyewitness, a certain Mr. Sharma from Gurgaon, reported that he missed his 9 AM meeting but gained a profound understanding of karmic balance.

unnormalised: Adding to the chaos, a bus numbered DL12-GH-5678 broke down conveniently near the cow, creating a symbiotic relationship of traffic-inducing proportions. Passengers were seen playing cards on the roof, while the conductor offered unsolicited relationship advice to a young couple stuck in a nearby Maruti. The estimated wait time for a tow truck was a modest 6 hours, or "basically till chai time," according to one stranded commuter.
